JobFullDesc:
You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.
At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible — and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way. When you join #TeamAmex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day. 
How we serve our customers is constantly evolving and is a challenge we gladly accept. Whether you’re finding new ways to prevent identity fraud or enabling customers to start a new business, you can work with one of the most valuable data sets in the world to identify insights and actions that can have a meaningful impact on our customers and our business. And, with opportunities to learn from leaders who have defined the course of our industry, you can grow your career and define your own path.
 
American Express Savings is an online direct bank that offers online FDIC-insured High-Yield Savings Accounts and Certificates of Deposit directly to consumers. The business has grown to over $60BN of direct deposits. The company is investing to continue growing direct deposits as stable, diversified sources of funding for the company’s businesses through differentiated, convenient deposit products and experiences that help customers achieve their savings aspirations in a unified digital Membership experience.
We are seeking a highly motivated product analytics manager with experience in digital products to join the Savings Product Management and PMO team. Our team is accountable for driving business outcomes through a customer-centric product roadmap and managing the customer experience across all product features, functionality and channels, ensuring that the Savings customer is central to every part of our business.  In this role, the candidate will have the opportunity to directly influence our product strategy and decision making, enabling and translating analytical insights into data-driven recommendations and opportunities to improve our existing products using both quantitative and qualitative analysis of customer behavior and feedback.  The person is this role will work with the Savings Product Managers as well as our Enterprise analytics partners to deliver holistic insights across the customer life-cycle.
How will you make an impact in this role?

Define and maintain Amex Savings Data product roadmap and collaborate with Enterprise Banking and Engineering teams to deliver capabilities through program increments (PIs)
Define and manage Data quality control measures for Saving ODLs and change management process and quality validations
Work with product managers to help determine and prioritize data requirements to support Savings initiatives, products and features 
Deliver ad hoc analyses and on-going dashboards to provide visibility into product performance and historic trends, and KPI tracking
Proactively propose insights and trends resulting from analyses to uncover growth opportunities and inform product roadmap
Develop analytical tools and capabilities to allow product team and key stakeholders to self-serve day-to-day data needs
Help define and support use cases for leveraging Savings data
Maintain End to end ownership of Savings data across platforms

Skills and Qualifications: 

Relevant Experience in Advance Analytics/Data Science domain
Strong Analytical skills combined with excellent presentation skills
Proficiency in Cornerstone environment, expert Excel and Tableau skills, and knowledge of database management systems (e.g., SQL, SAS etc.)
Experience with platforms such as Hadoop, Hive, etc. 
Experience as a product manager preferably with data management, data governance and/or related domain
Experience with project management methodologies (Agile) 
A successful history of manipulating & extracting value from data
Demonstrated ability to work independently and across a matrix organization partnering with business, capabilities, and technology teams to deliver solutions at top speed
Strong strategic thinker with the ability to translate trends and analysis into actionable recommendations
Transformation mindset with strong customer focus
Exceptional relationship management and conflict resolution skills; with a proven track record of influencing and gaining buy-in for product strategies
Strong problem-solving skills, critical-thinking skills, strong business acumen and the proven ability to effectively articulate business objectives required
Strong facilitation/presentation skills and experience presenting to senior leadership

 
Preferred Skills and Qualifications:

3+ years of experience in Product Management and/or Product Development preferred; and
Bachelor's degree required; Bachelor's (or comparable experience) in Business, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics or Marketing is highly preferred
Data Automation Solution using Python, SQL, HQL, Alteryx, R - Solution development using NLP, AI, Application Interfaces, Webservices - Data visualization tools

American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.
 
Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.
 
Offer of employment with American Express is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background verification check, subject to applicable laws and regulations.
